name: Armor Potency (+1)
desc:
Magic wards deflect attacks. Increase the armor's item bonus to AC by 1. The armor can be etched with one property rune.

You can upgrade the armor potency rune already etched on a suit of armor to a stronger version, increasing the values of the existing rune to those of the new rune. You must have the formula of the stronger rune to do so, and the Price of the upgrade is the difference between the two runes' Prices.
craftRequirement: You are an expert in Crafting.

name: Glamered
desc: This armor can be disguised with a mere thought.

activities.desc: You change the shape and appearance of this armor to appear as ordinary or fine clothes of your imagining. The armor's statistics do not change. Only a creature that is benefiting from true seeing or a similar effect can attempt to disbelieve this illusion, with a DC of 25.
activities.name: Glamered Rune

name: Slick
desc: This property makes armor slippery, as though it were coated with a thin film of oil. You gain a +1 item bonus to Acrobatics checks to Escape and Squeeze.

hints.desc: You gain a +1 item bonus to Acrobatics checks to Escape and Squeeze.

name: Shadow
desc: Armor with this rune becomes hazy black. You gain a +1 item bonus to Stealth checks while wearing the armor.
usage: etched onto light or medium nonmetallic armor

name: Energy-Resistant (Acid)
desc: These symbols convey protective forces from the Elemental Planes. You gain resistance 5 to acid, cold, electricity, or fire. The crafter chooses the damage type when creating the rune. Multiple energy-resistant runes can be etched onto a suit of armor; rather than using only the highest-level effect, each must provide resistance to a different damage type. For instance, a +2 acid-resistant greater fire-resistant breastplate would give you acid resistance 5 and fire resistance 10.

name: Energy-Resistant (Cold)
desc: These symbols convey protective forces from the Elemental Planes. You gain resistance 5 to acid, cold, electricity, or fire. The crafter chooses the damage type when creating the rune. Multiple energy-resistant runes can be etched onto a suit of armor; rather than using only the highest-level effect, each must provide resistance to a different damage type. For instance, a +2 acid-resistant greater fire-resistant breastplate would give you acid resistance 5 and fire resistance 10.

name: Energy-Resistant (Electricity)
desc: These symbols convey protective forces from the Elemental Planes. You gain resistance 5 to acid, cold, electricity, or fire. The crafter chooses the damage type when creating the rune. Multiple energy-resistant runes can be etched onto a suit of armor; rather than using only the highest-level effect, each must provide resistance to a different damage type. For instance, a +2 acid-resistant greater fire-resistant breastplate would give you acid resistance 5 and fire resistance 10.

name: Energy-Resistant (Fire)
desc: These symbols convey protective forces from the Elemental Planes. You gain resistance 5 to acid, cold, electricity, or fire. The crafter chooses the damage type when creating the rune. Multiple energy-resistant runes can be etched onto a suit of armor; rather than using only the highest-level effect, each must provide resistance to a different damage type. For instance, a +2 acid-resistant greater fire-resistant breastplate would give you acid resistance 5 and fire resistance 10.

name: Invisibility
desc: Light seems to partially penetrate this armor.

activities.desc: Whispering the command word, you become invisible for 1 minute, gaining the effects of a 2nd-level invisibility spell.
activities.name: Invisibility Rune

name: Resilient
desc:
Resilient runes imbue armor with additional protective magic. This grants the wearer a +1 item bonus to saving throws.

You can upgrade the resilient rune already etched on a suit of armor to a stronger version, increasing the values of the existing rune to those of the new rune. You must have the formula of the stronger rune to do so, and the Price of the upgrade is the difference between the two runes' Prices.

name: Slick (Greater)
desc: This property makes armor slippery, as though it were coated with a thin film of oil. You gain a +1 item bonus to Acrobatics checks to Escape and Squeeze.

hints.desc: You gain a +2 item bonus to Acrobatics checks to Escape and Squeeze.

name: Shadow (Greater)
desc: Armor with this rune becomes hazy black. You gain a +1 item bonus to Stealth checks while wearing the armor.
usage: etched onto light or medium nonmetallic armor

name: Invisibility (Greater)
desc: Light seems to partially penetrate this armor.
subTypeDesc: You can activate the armor up to three times per day.

activities.desc: Whispering the command word, you become invisible for 1 minute, gaining the effects of a 2nd-level invisibility spell.
activities.name: Greater Invisibility Rune: 1st activation

subTypeDesc: Increase the armor's item bonus to AC by 2, and the armor can be etched with two property runes.
craftRequirement: You are a master in Crafting.

desc: These symbols convey protective forces from the Elemental Planes. You gain resistance 5 to acid, cold, electricity, or fire. The crafter chooses the damage type when creating the rune. Multiple energy-resistant runes can be etched onto a suit of armor; rather than using only the highest-level effect, each must provide resistance to a different damage type. For instance, a +2 acid-resistant greater fire-resistant breastplate would give you acid resistance 5 and fire resistance 10.

desc: These symbols convey protective forces from the Elemental Planes. You gain resistance 5 to acid, cold, electricity, or fire. The crafter chooses the damage type when creating the rune. Multiple energy-resistant runes can be etched onto a suit of armor; rather than using only the highest-level effect, each must provide resistance to a different damage type. For instance, a +2 acid-resistant greater fire-resistant breastplate would give you acid resistance 5 and fire resistance 10.

desc: These symbols convey protective forces from the Elemental Planes. You gain resistance 5 to acid, cold, electricity, or fire. The crafter chooses the damage type when creating the rune. Multiple energy-resistant runes can be etched onto a suit of armor; rather than using only the highest-level effect, each must provide resistance to a different damage type. For instance, a +2 acid-resistant greater fire-resistant breastplate would give you acid resistance 5 and fire resistance 10.

name: Energy-Resistant (Fire, Greater)
desc: These symbols convey protective forces from the Elemental Planes. You gain resistance 5 to acid, cold, electricity, or fire. The crafter chooses the damage type when creating the rune. Multiple energy-resistant runes can be etched onto a suit of armor; rather than using only the highest-level effect, each must provide resistance to a different damage type. For instance, a +2 acid-resistant greater fire-resistant breastplate would give you acid resistance 5 and fire resistance 10.

name: Fortification
desc: A fortification rune wards against the most deadly attacks. Each time you're critically hit while wearing the etched armor, attempt a DC 17 flat check. On a success, it becomes a normal hit. This property thickens the armor, increasing its Bulk by 1 and the Strength required to reduce its penalties by 2.
usage: etched onto medium or heavy armor

hints.desc: Each time you're critically hit while wearing the etched armor, attempt a DC 17 flat check. On a success, it becomes a normal hit.

name: Resilient (Greater)
desc:
Resilient runes imbue armor with additional protective magic. This grants the wearer a +1 item bonus to saving throws.

You can upgrade the resilient rune already etched on a suit of armor to a stronger version, increasing the values of the existing rune to those of the new rune. You must have the formula of the stronger rune to do so, and the Price of the upgrade is the difference between the two runes' Prices.
subTypeDesc: The armor grants a +2 item bonus to saving throws.

name: Antimagic
desc: This intricate rune displaces spell energy, granting you a +1 status bonus to saving throws against magical effects.
craftRequirement: Supply one casting of dispel magic.

activities.desc: The armor attempts to counteract the triggering spell with the effect of a 7th-level dispel magic spell and a counteract modifier of +26.
activities.name: Antimagic Rune
activities.trigger: A spell targets you or includes you in its area

hints.desc: You gain a +1 status bonus to saving throws against magical effects.

name: Slick (Major)
desc: This property makes armor slippery, as though it were coated with a thin film of oil. You gain a +1 item bonus to Acrobatics checks to Escape and Squeeze.

hints.desc: You gain a +3 item bonus to Acrobatics checks to Escape and Squeeze.

name: Ethereal
desc: An ethereal rune replicates armor on the Ethereal Plane.
craftRequirement: Supply a casting of 9th level ethereal jaunt.

activities.desc: You gain the effects of an ethereal jaunt spell. This doesn't require concentration and lasts for 10 minutes or until you choose to return to material form as a free action.
activities.name: Ethereal Rune

name: Shadow (Major)
desc: Armor with this rune becomes hazy black. You gain a +1 item bonus to Stealth checks while wearing the armor.
usage: etched onto light or medium nonmetallic armor
